title: Police officer caught on camera ploughing into a teenager is found guilty of dangerous driving
text:
A police officer who was filmed hitting a teenager with his car and leaving him with injuries all over his body has been found guilty of dangerous driving.

Senior Sergeant Richard Stephen Moore was filmed by several people ploughing into William Farmer at a roundabout on Wilfred Street in Thornlie in south-east Perth in May 2018.

Mr Farmer convulsed violently on the road after the car struck him and he suffered from a large graze on his stomach and side.

Snr Sgt Moore denied any wrongdoing and claimed he had only wanted to block the teenager, but Magistrate Tom Hall found turning a two-tonne car 'very quickly and very sharply was dangerous,' the ABC reported.

Senior Sergeant Richard Stephen Moore was filmed by several people ploughing into William Farmer at a roundabout on Wilfred Street in Thornlie in south-east Perth in May 2018

The court heard Snr Sgt Moore and his partner were called to the area after reports of someone knocking on doors and asking residents for cigarettes.

The officers confronted Mr Farmer about the incident before he fled and they chased him.

The court also heard Mr Farmer tried to open doors of passing vehicles and Snr Sgt Moore believed he was trying to steal a car.

Snr Sgt Moore put one handcuff on Mr Farmer but he slipped away and continued to try and escape.

He believed Mr Farmer could have used the handcuff as a weapon.

Mr Farmer convulsed violently on the road after the car struck him and he suffered from a large graze on his stomach and side. Snr Sgt Moore was found guilty of dangerous driving

This is when Snr Sgt Moore entered his vehicle, drove on the wrong side of the road and hit Mr Farmer.

His lawyer, Linda Black, argued Mr Farmer 'presented a considerate threat to the community.'

An ambulance was called and Mr Farmer was treated at Fiona Stanley Hospital for minor injuries.

Ms Black estimated Snr Sgt Moore was only driving six or seven kilometres per hour when he struck Mr Farmer.
